title: Singleton bound
summary: In coding theory, the Singleton bound, named after Richard Collom Singleton, is a relatively crude upper bound on the size of an arbitrary block code C {\displaystyle C} with block length n {\displaystyle n} , size M {\displaystyle M} and minimum distance d {\displaystyle d} . It is also known as the Joshibound.[1] proved by Joshi (1958) and even earlier by Komamiya (1953).
